trans-unit.source: Performance levels in DocumentDB | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Performance levels in DocumentDB | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn about how performance levels in DocumentDB enable you to reserve throughput on a per collection basis.
trans-unit.target: Learn about how performance levels in DocumentDB enable you to reserve throughput on a per collection basis.

trans-unit.source: Performance levels in DocumentDB
trans-unit.target: Performance levels in DocumentDB

trans-unit.source: This article provides an overview of performance levels in <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an overview of performance levels in <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: After reading this article, you'll be able to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: After reading this article, you'll be able to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: What is a performance level?
trans-unit.target: What is a performance level?

trans-unit.source: How is throughput reserved for a database account?
trans-unit.target: How is throughput reserved for a database account?

trans-unit.source: How do I work with performance levels?
trans-unit.target: How do I work with performance levels?

trans-unit.source: How am I billed for performance levels?
trans-unit.target: How am I billed for performance levels?

trans-unit.source: Introduction to performance levels
trans-unit.target: Introduction to performance levels

trans-unit.source: Each DocumentDB collection created under a Standard account is provisioned with an associated performance level.
trans-unit.target: Each DocumentDB collection created under a Standard account is provisioned with an associated performance level.

trans-unit.source: Performance levels are designated as S1, S2 or S3 ranging from lowest to highest in performance.
trans-unit.target: Performance levels are designated as S1, S2 or S3 ranging from lowest to highest in performance.

trans-unit.source: The collection’s performance level determines the amount of service resources reserved for your application.
trans-unit.target: The collection’s performance level determines the amount of service resources reserved for your application.

trans-unit.source: Each collection in a database can have a different performance level allowing you to designate more throughput for frequently accessed collections and less throughput for infrequently accessed collections.
trans-unit.target: Each collection in a database can have a different performance level allowing you to designate more throughput for frequently accessed collections and less throughput for infrequently accessed collections.

trans-unit.source: Each performance level has an associated request unit (RU) rate limit.
trans-unit.target: Each performance level has an associated request unit (RU) rate limit.

trans-unit.source: This is the throughput that will be reserved for a collection based on its performance level, and is available for use by that collection exclusively.
trans-unit.target: This is the throughput that will be reserved for a collection based on its performance level, and is available for use by that collection exclusively.

trans-unit.source: Collections can be created through the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link> or any of the <link><linkText>DocumentDB SDKs</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Collections can be created through the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link> or any of the <link><linkText>DocumentDB SDKs</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The DocumentDB APIs allow you to specify the performance level of a collection.
trans-unit.target: The DocumentDB APIs allow you to specify the performance level of a collection.

trans-unit.source: Collection performance leve
trans-unit.target: Collection performance leve

trans-unit.source: Reserved throughput
trans-unit.target: Reserved throughput

trans-unit.source: S1
trans-unit.target: S1

trans-unit.source: 250 RU/sec
trans-unit.target: 250 RU/sec

trans-unit.source: S2
trans-unit.target: S2

trans-unit.source: 1000 RU/sec
trans-unit.target: 1000 RU/sec

trans-unit.source: S3
trans-unit.target: S3

trans-unit.source: 2500 RU/sec
trans-unit.target: 2500 RU/sec

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB allows for a rich set of database operations including queries, queries with user-defined functions (UDFs), stored procedures and triggers.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB allows for a rich set of database operations including queries, queries with user-defined functions (UDFs), stored procedures and triggers.

trans-unit.source: The processing cost associated with each of these operations will vary based on the CPU, IO and memory required to complete the operation.
trans-unit.target: The processing cost associated with each of these operations will vary based on the CPU, IO and memory required to complete the operation.

trans-unit.source: Instead of thinking about and managing hardware resources, you can think of a request unit as a single measure for the resources required to perform various database operations and service an application request.
trans-unit.target: Instead of thinking about and managing hardware resources, you can think of a request unit as a single measure for the resources required to perform various database operations and service an application request.

trans-unit.source: Performance levels are measured in request units.
trans-unit.target: Performance levels are measured in request units.

trans-unit.source: Each performance level has an associated maximum request unit per second rate.
trans-unit.target: Each performance level has an associated maximum request unit per second rate.

trans-unit.source: The performance level of a collection can be adjusted through the APIs or the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The performance level of a collection can be adjusted through the APIs or the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Setting performance levels for collections
trans-unit.target: Setting performance levels for collections

trans-unit.source: Once a collection is created, the full allocation of RUs based on the designated performance level are reserved for the collection.
trans-unit.target: Once a collection is created, the full allocation of RUs based on the designated performance level are reserved for the collection.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a collection is set as S3 – the collection is capable of processing 2,500 RUs/sec.
trans-unit.target: For example, if a collection is set as S3 – the collection is capable of processing 2,500 RUs/sec.

trans-unit.source: Each collection reserves its designated throughput and 10GB of database storage.
trans-unit.target: Each collection reserves its designated throughput and 10GB of database storage.

trans-unit.source: The price of the collection will vary based on the performance level chosen (S1, S2, S3).
trans-unit.target: The price of the collection will vary based on the performance level chosen (S1, S2, S3).

trans-unit.source: Note that DocumentDB operates based on capacity reservation; by creating a collection, an application has reserved and is billed for reserved throughput and database storage, regardless of how much of that storage and throughput is actively used.
trans-unit.target: Note that DocumentDB operates based on capacity reservation; by creating a collection, an application has reserved and is billed for reserved throughput and database storage, regardless of how much of that storage and throughput is actively used.

trans-unit.source: After collections are created, you can modify the performance level through the DocumentDB SDKs or through the Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: After collections are created, you can modify the performance level through the DocumentDB SDKs or through the Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB Standard collections are billed at an hourly rate and each collection you create will be billed for a minimum one hour of usage.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB Standard collections are billed at an hourly rate and each collection you create will be billed for a minimum one hour of usage.

trans-unit.source: If you adjust the performance level of a collection within an hour, you will be billed for the highest performance level set during the hour.
trans-unit.target: If you adjust the performance level of a collection within an hour, you will be billed for the highest performance level set during the hour.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you increase your performance level for a collection at 8:53am you will be charged for the new level starting at 8:00am.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you increase your performance level for a collection at 8:53am you will be charged for the new level starting at 8:00am.

trans-unit.source: Likewise, if you decrease your performance level at 8:53am, the new rate will be applied at 9:00am.
trans-unit.target: Likewise, if you decrease your performance level at 8:53am, the new rate will be applied at 9:00am.

trans-unit.source: Request units are reserved for each collection based on the performance level set.
trans-unit.target: Request units are reserved for each collection based on the performance level set.

trans-unit.source: Request unit consumption is evaluated as a per second rate.
trans-unit.target: Request unit consumption is evaluated as a per second rate.

trans-unit.source: Applications that exceed the provisioned request unit rate (or performance level) on a collection will be throttled until the rate drops below the reserved level for that collection.
trans-unit.target: Applications that exceed the provisioned request unit rate (or performance level) on a collection will be throttled until the rate drops below the reserved level for that collection.

trans-unit.source: If your application requires a higher level of throughput, you can increase the performance level for each collection.
trans-unit.target: If your application requires a higher level of throughput, you can increase the performance level for each collection.

trans-unit.source: When your application exceeds performance levels for one or multiple collections, requests will be throttled on a per collection basis.
trans-unit.target: When your application exceeds performance levels for one or multiple collections, requests will be throttled on a per collection basis.

trans-unit.source: This means that some application requests may succeed while others may be throttled.
trans-unit.target: This means that some application requests may succeed while others may be throttled.

trans-unit.source: Working with performance levels
trans-unit.target: Working with performance levels

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB collections allow you to partition your data based on both the query patterns and performance needs of your application.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB collections allow you to partition your data based on both the query patterns and performance needs of your application.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the <link><linkText>partitioning data documentation</linkText><title></title></link> for more details on partitioning data with DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the <link><linkText>partitioning data documentation</linkText><title></title></link> for more details on partitioning data with DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: With DocumentDB’s automatic indexing and query support, it is quite common to collocate heterogeneous documents within the same collection.
trans-unit.target: With DocumentDB’s automatic indexing and query support, it is quite common to collocate heterogeneous documents within the same collection.

trans-unit.source: The key considerations in deciding whether separate collections should be used include:
trans-unit.target: The key considerations in deciding whether separate collections should be used include:

trans-unit.source: Queries – A collection is the scope for query execution.
trans-unit.target: Queries – A collection is the scope for query execution.

trans-unit.source: If you need to query across a set of documents, the most efficient read patterns come from collocating documents in a single collection.
trans-unit.target: If you need to query across a set of documents, the most efficient read patterns come from collocating documents in a single collection.

trans-unit.source: Transactions – A collection is the transaction domain for stored procedures and triggers.
trans-unit.target: Transactions – A collection is the transaction domain for stored procedures and triggers.

trans-unit.source: All transactions are scoped to a single collection.
trans-unit.target: All transactions are scoped to a single collection.

trans-unit.source: Performance – A collection has an associated performance level.
trans-unit.target: Performance – A collection has an associated performance level.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that each collection has a predictable performance through reserved RUs.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that each collection has a predictable performance through reserved RUs.

trans-unit.source: Data can be allocated to different collections, with different performance levels, based on access frequency.
trans-unit.target: Data can be allocated to different collections, with different performance levels, based on access frequency.

trans-unit.source: It is important to understand you will be billed at full standard rates based on the number of collections created by your application.
trans-unit.target: It is important to understand you will be billed at full standard rates based on the number of collections created by your application.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that your application makes use of a small number of collections unless you have large storage or throughput requirements.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that your application makes use of a small number of collections unless you have large storage or throughput requirements.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you have well understood application patterns for the creation of new collections.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you have well understood application patterns for the creation of new collections.

trans-unit.source: You may choose to reserve collection creation as a management action handled outside your application.
trans-unit.target: You may choose to reserve collection creation as a management action handled outside your application.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, adjusting the performance level for a collection will change the hourly rate at which the collection is billed.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, adjusting the performance level for a collection will change the hourly rate at which the collection is billed.

trans-unit.source: You should monitor collection performance levels if your application adjusts these dynamically.
trans-unit.target: You should monitor collection performance levels if your application adjusts these dynamically.

trans-unit.source: Changing performance levels using the Azure Preview portal
trans-unit.target: Changing performance levels using the Azure Preview portal

trans-unit.source: The Azure Preview portal is one option available to you when managing your collections' performance levels.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Preview portal is one option available to you when managing your collections' performance levels.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to change a collection's performance level from the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to change a collection's performance level from the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Navigate over to the <link><linkText>**Azure Preview portal**</linkText><title></title></link> from your browser.
trans-unit.target: Navigate over to the <link><linkText>**Azure Preview portal**</linkText><title></title></link> from your browser.

trans-unit.source: Click Browse from the jump bar on the left side.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse from the jump bar on the left side.

trans-unit.source: In the Browse hub, click DocumentDB Accounts under the Filter by label.
trans-unit.target: In the Browse hub, click DocumentDB Accounts under the Filter by label.

trans-unit.source: In the DocumentDB Accounts blade, click the DocumentDB account that contains the desired collection.
trans-unit.target: In the DocumentDB Accounts blade, click the DocumentDB account that contains the desired collection.

trans-unit.source: In the DocumentDB Account blade, scroll down to the Databases lens and click the database that contains the desired collection.
trans-unit.target: In the DocumentDB Account blade, scroll down to the Databases lens and click the database that contains the desired collection.

trans-unit.source: In the newly opened Database blade, scroll down to the Collections lens and select your desired collection.
trans-unit.target: In the newly opened Database blade, scroll down to the Collections lens and select your desired collection.

trans-unit.source: Finally, within your Collection blade, find and click the Pricing tier tile in the Usage lens.
trans-unit.target: Finally, within your Collection blade, find and click the Pricing tier tile in the Usage lens.

trans-unit.source: In the Choose your pricing tier blade, click the desired performance level and then click Select at the bottom of the blade.
trans-unit.target: In the Choose your pricing tier blade, click the desired performance level and then click Select at the bottom of the blade.

trans-unit.source: Changing performance levels of a collection may take up to 2 minutes.
trans-unit.target: Changing performance levels of a collection may take up to 2 minutes.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Changing pricing tier</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Changing pricing tier</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Changing performance levels using the .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Changing performance levels using the .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: Another option for changing your collections' performance levels is through our SDKs.
trans-unit.target: Another option for changing your collections' performance levels is through our SDKs.

trans-unit.source: This section only covers changing a collection's performance level using our <link><linkText>.NET SDK</linkText><title></title></link>, but the process is similar for our other <link><linkText>SDKs</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This section only covers changing a collection's performance level using our <link><linkText>.NET SDK</linkText><title></title></link>, but the process is similar for our other <link><linkText>SDKs</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you are new to our .NET SDK, please visit our <link><linkText>getting started tutorial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you are new to our .NET SDK, please visit our <link><linkText>getting started tutorial</linkText><title></title></link>.
